page.title: 17LIFE IN PLASMARL, SWANSEA
page.content: Many people think Plasmarl is a boring place, but if you look around you will find many interesting things. There are many local pubs around Plasmarl for older people, where they can have a quiet drink and a chat or play snooker or darts. Sometimes there is also entertainment. For younger children there are activities such as Cubs and Brownies held in St. Paul's Church. For older children there are Scouts and Guides. Children who take an interest in sport can practise a variety of events at the Morfa Stadium. For those children who like dancing there is a club called the "Peppermint", where they meet new friends and learn to dance to different types of music. The community also has the use of a hall in Dinas Street for parties and Bingo.
